file_content.text: Thank you again, my lord. I look forward to working with you.
I hope we meet again, my lord. It's been a pleasure.
My lord! I hoped to catch you before you left! I, um, I have resigned from the service.
The military just isn't the best use of my talents. I feel I could serve the Empire better... by, um, by helping you. If you'll let me.
I can always use another lover of the strange. It would be an honor.
Of course.
I promise, I won't let you--wait, you will? Great. Great! Thank you!
You won't regret it. I have military training--rifles, small arms, grenades. And I'm the best in the galaxy at finding rare artifacts, if I may say so.
Let's hope you have a strong stomach, huh.
The ship's getting crowded. Are you sure we can use him?
He's not lying. Lieutenant Drellik has quite the reputation in his field. He's the perfect combination of brilliant, valuable and deceptively non-threatening.
Remarkable. Are you another ghost, or...?
Something like that. Perhaps I'll tell you about it some time.
Please, I promise, I won't let you down.
We'll be honored to have you, then.
Welcome aboard.
Oh, all right.
Forget it.
I--I'm sorry. I guess I can still get my post back, then. I'm sorry I wasted your time.
I promise, I won't let you down.
Why should I do that?
I'm sorry, have we met? All these Imperial uniforms, they blur together....
Who are you again?
Sorry. It's Talos, Lieutenant Drellik. I... I helped you into the temple of the Sadow'een. Remember?
I have military training--rifles, small arms, grenades. And, well, I don't like to brag, but I've been called the best in my profession.
Heh. You don't know what you're asking, Lieutenant. Trying to join this group.
I must get back to the Imperial outpost.
I believe the ghost said he was in the dreadnaught. Best go there if you wish to find him.
Here we are. Now, I have to analyze this droid, but your friends said they'd be here if you needed them.
If you must destroy the relics, do it quickly. I can't bear to look.
Ah, there. I must be out of practice.
This shouldn't take too long.
We must go to the Temple.
Your ghost said he was a follower of Ludo Kressh, and that Naga Sadow's assassins killed him. Sith, do you realize what you've done?
What have I done, exactly?
You'll have to explain it.
This must be the greatest discovery since my mentor Auselio Gann unearthed the wing of Naga Sadow's own fighter on Yavin Four!
Can you get me inside or can't you?
I don't have time for this.
I wouldn't miss a discovery like this for all the scrolls in the Dark Temple.
You're cute when you're excited.
[Flirt] Aren't you sweet.
Well, um, thank you. How kind of you to say.
Let's not get carried away here.
Easy now.
Not get carried away? Impossible.
We're talking about the fabled Sadow'een, Naga Sadow's personal order of assassins--myth made real!
Don't worry, I'll get you inside. I've been circumventing the security of ancient tombs since I was old enough to hold a data spike and a pair of pliers.
Good.
Let me just gather up my equipment here... all right, let's go!
A data spike and pliers?
Don't you have better tools?
I have far more advanced equipment at my disposal now. It'll open tomb doors and make tea while you wait.
Provided you know how to use it, of course. Now, we have a temple to discover!
Then shut up and get me into that temple.
More work, less chatter.
Yes, my lord! With pleasure!
I'll meet you out at the next Imperial base, alright? Don't get yourself killed.
I will await your return at the next Imperial base, my master. Meet me there when it's time.
I was hoping we could continue my training, but... I can wait. I'll meet you at the next Imperial base, my master.
I met the ghost, and he needs me to get inside an ancient temple....
Then it's true! My peers in the service laughed when I said it was on Hoth, but now--yes, it's the only thing that makes sense.
We're close, boys. We'll find that temple. I can feel it. Rogers! No cutting corners! Don't forget the salt!
Salt's not the best solution, but it's the only thing that doesn't freeze out here, and solid footing is a must.
I'm looking for Lieutenant Talos Drellik, of the Imperial Reclamation Service.
Lieutenant Drellik, I presume.
My lord, I am honored.
You are in the presence of a Lord of the Sith. Act it.
Show some respect.
Apologies, my lord. I forget my profession is not of interest to everyone.
You're kidding.
My lord, you can never be too cautious. The dead dislike having their graves rifled, even for posterity.
I heard you single-handedly unearthed artifacts of the great Tulak Hord. I'm a Naga Sadow man myself, but I'd love to compare notes.
What brings you to Hoth, and how may I be of service?
I'm taking over this team in order to locate a ship called the Starrunner.
You can help me find a ship.
I heard that a ship carrying artifacts from Yavin Four went down over Hoth.
Just chasing rumors.
I'm hunting a ghost, actually. On a crashed ship.
You won't believe it.
Hmm. A ship. Not usually our line, but let's hear it. Maybe we can help....
Hmm. A bit new for the Reclamation Service... but artifacts. And a ghost!
I've heard that the dead talk down in the tombs, but to see one! I wonder if it'd be possible to make a holo-image....
I imagine it would depend on the light.
It may be possible.
Yes, darker would be better....
I doubt you'll get a chance to take pictures.
You won't have time.
It doesn't hurt to be prepared.
Just tell me if you can find me the ship!
I don't have time for this.
I found the caves of Skarok-Nur, Ludo Kressh's secret apprentice, didn't I? And it only took me three years.
Engineer Sorrel! Do we have any probes that aren't frozen solid?
Shalora works as good as any in these conditions, sir. She may not look like much, but she's got heart.
You're loonier than I am.
If my guess is correct, the captain would've launched a distress beacon before the crash, which should give us a line on the ship.
Beware, my lord. The cold's master out here.
Sounds easy.
Excellent. I've triangulated out a rough area where I think the beacon would've landed.
Aren't you supposed to be in the Imperial military?
You're not going to help?
We do a more conceptual sort of soldiering. We fight the dark army of forgetting that threatens our history.
My boys and I are going to shift camp, try to get a better communications setup going, but let us know if you find anything.
I'm sorry, I'm busy.
Hmm. Must be out of practice. But here we are!
Escort Sorrel and the probe to the crash site and we'll find your ghost!
Our chances are better if you accompany the probe. It's likely to break, and Sorrel will need protection while fixing it.
Come, Sorrel, our destinies await.
Very well.
Excellent.
